intro: Cleistocactus villamontesii, commonly known as the Mexican night bloomer, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces fragrant, night-blooming flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in arid environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its unique flowering behavior, it is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
